image.altText: Hands holding a purple-cover report held close to the body

props.synopsis: The South Australian government has committed more than $600 million over a decade to reduce the prevalence of — and protect the victims of — domestic, family and sexual violence, in response to a landmark royal commission earlier this year.

title.children: Domestic violence royal commission prompts $674 million response

image.altText: A man in a plaid yellow shirt, glasses and face mask walks out of court being questioned by reporters.

props.synopsis: An unqualified massage therapist who sexually abused more than 60 women left his victims with "trauma" and "severe psychological harm", a court has heard. Warning: This story contains descriptions of sexual abuse.

title.children: Victims tell court of trauma inflicted by Adelaide massage therapist

image.altText: A hand dropping very fine, dry soil.

props.synopsis: The federal government is introducing new low-interest loans for drought-affected farmers and algae-impacted fishers, but some are worried it doesn't go far enough.

title.children: Farmers and fishers offered lifeline as government expands loans

image.altText: A man standing over a map and soil samples.

props.synopsis: The processing market is dominated by China, but Australia is building its capabilities in an attempt to boost the domestic industry.

title.children: First Australian rare earth processing facility under construction

image.altText: Ashton Hurn talks to the media while flanked by five other ministers

props.synopsis: South Australia's new Liberal leader Ashton Hurn unveils a "streamlined" shadow cabinet, just 99 days out from the next state election.

title.children: New SA Liberal leader unveils shadow cabinet

image.altText: Ashton Hurn looks to the right of screen in front of six microphones

props.synopsis: Only days after taking her party's top job, Liberal leader Ashton Hurn is under pressure on a key election promise.

title.children: Labor tries to end Ashton Hurn's 'honeymoon' early

image.altText: A police officer in uniform surrounded by cameras in front of dark glass doors

props.synopsis: South Australia's top cop has taken on an extra role, joining the Adelaide Football Club's board of directors.

title.children: Adelaide Crows appoint Police Commissioner Grant Stevens to club's board

image.altText: A photo of Chris Robertson whose death is being treated as murder.

props.synopsis: Police have arrested a 30-year-old man for the alleged murder of Adelaide father-of-two Chris Robertson, who was found dead in a Lonsdale workshop in September.

title.children: Police arrest man for alleged murder of father-of-two Chris Robertson

image.altText: A Public Service Association rally in Adelaide's CBD.

props.synopsis: Strike action involving prison officers has again escalated, forcing the closure of SA's major courts and causing disruptions to case hearings, which will now be rescheduled.

title.children: SA courts close amid escalating dispute over prison staff pay

image.altText: A man with grey shoulder-length hair and beard gestures with his hand, a woman withe blonde hair stands behind him

props.synopsis: Authorities say the "best signs" in a "long time" have been observed in the latest round of monitoring of the state's algal bloom crisis.

title.children: 'Best signs we've seen': SA algal testing shows positive signs ahead of peak summer period

image.altText: A midddle-aged, dark-haired man gives the thumbs up while standing before the media underneath an awning.

props.synopsis: Jeffrey Purse says a court's decision to dismiss an appeal by his son's killer offers "some justice" for his family, as the search for Michael Purse's remains continues.

title.children: Father's relief as son's murderer loses appeal against conviction

image.altText: Susan Close in a red top speaks into a microphone in front of large glass windows

props.synopsis: South Australia's former deputy premier Susan Close has called out what she describes as "extreme" socio-economic segregation in Australian schools.

title.children: Australia's education system is out of step, former SA deputy premier says

image.altText: A pair of hand hold two extra-large strawberries.

props.synopsis: Seasonal conditions are leading to big berries this summer, with the fruit on the larger side in some regions because of a wetter spring.

title.children: Supersized strawberries fill supermarket shelves

image.altText: A composite image of a middle-aged man in a suit smiling and chatting and a younger woman chatting smiling

props.synopsis: Ashton Hurn now has the job she said she didn't want. Could she be the leader the South Australian Liberal Party needs?

title.children: The political forces working for and against Ashton Hurn

image.altText: A selfie of a woman with dyed maroon coloured hair

props.synopsis: Alicia Kemp is sentenced to four years behind bars after the 25-year-old English backpacker hit and killed Thanh Phan as she rode an e-scooter while drunk in Perth's CBD.

title.children: 'E-scooters are not toys': UK backpacker jailed over pedestrian death

image.altText: The exterior of a white casino building with shrapnel holes and burn marks.

props.synopsis: An expert says the Thai military's strikes on Cambodian casinos and suspected scam centres could be putting the lives of civilians and human trafficking victims at risk and may be considered war crimes.

title.children: Thailand bombs Cambodian casinos and scam centres

image.altText: A red X on a map of Japan shows the location of an earthquake off its northeast coast

props.synopsis: The quake struck off Japan's north-east coast with a depth of 20 kilometres, after a bigger, 7.5-magnitude earthquake hit the same region late on Monday.

title.children: Tsunami warning for northern Japan called off after magnitude 6.9 earthquake

image.altText: A man in a Transportation Security Administration uniform checks a person's passport

props.synopsis: Mean tweets about US policy might mean no trip to Disneyland, under a new proposal that would see Australians provide their social media history for the past five years.

title.children: What does US proposal on tourists disclosing social media mean for Australians?

image.altText: A orange tent on sand with meteors in the background.

props.synopsis: You'll need to get up early, but the views could be worth it to catch the best glimpse of the Geminids meteor shower this weekend.

title.children: How to see Australia's best meteor shower this weekend

image.altText: A screengrab of a message from Instagram with Ms Cronk's profile, telling her her account had been disabled.

props.synopsis: A mother of three is urgently trying to regain access to her social media business accounts after being locked out during the blanket under-16s social media ban.

title.children: 30yo mother can't access social accounts after being caught in under-16s ban

image.altText: close up of Bulgarian Prime Minister Rosen Zhelyazkov

props.synopsis: Bulgaria's prime minister announced the decision in a televised address saying "ahead of today's vote of no confidence, the government is resigning".

title.children: Bulgaria faces turmoil after anti-corruption protests topple government

image.altText: ANZ CEO Shayne Elliott

props.synopsis: Shayne Elliott says he has been left with "no alternative" but to launch legal action against the bank over its decision to slash $13.5 million from his bonus payments after he retired.

title.children: Former ANZ CEO launches legal action against the bank

image.altText: Tyler Robinson in a court room with a neutral expression.

props.synopsis: Lawyers for Tyler Robinson, the man accused of killing conservative activist Charlie Kirk, have sought to limit media access to ensure a fair trial.

title.children: Suspect in Charlie Kirk killing makes first in-court appearance

image.altText: A baked ham leg glazed with maple syrup and spices, a simple recipe for Christmas.

props.synopsis: Christmas is around the corner and we have plenty of delicious ideas whether you're hosting or bringing dessert.

title.children: Plan Christmas with our 10 essential recipes

image.altText: A row of Matildas walks towards the camera in uniform with a black background.

props.synopsis: The 23-minute video portrait of the Matildas 2023 World Cup squad cost $400,000, in what the National Portrait Gallery describes as its most ambitious commission ever.

title.children: 'I did start tearing up': $400k Matildas portrait unveiled

image.altText: A picture of a boy and his grandmother smiling

props.synopsis: The lawsuit is one of a growing number of wrongful death legal actions against AI chatbot makers across the country.

title.children: OpenAI sued for allegedly enabling murder-suicide in US

image.altText: A hospital bed is pushed down a corridor towards the camera.

props.synopsis: State health ministers had their final meeting of the year with their federal counterpart on Friday armed with figures showing a 25 per cent increase in just three months of aged care patients stranded in hospitals.

title.children: 'Furious' states attack feds over aged care patients in hospitals

image.altText: A boy in wheelchair with bandages and nasal stent smiles as he drinks a can of soda.

props.synopsis: The boy was dragged under a car for more than 100 metres, with the judge saying she does not know how he survived.

title.children: Man jailed for hit-and-run that left 3yo in critical condition

image.altText: A mobile icon of the Reddit app.

props.synopsis: Reddit has filed a High Court challenge alleging that Australia's social media restrictions are being applied to the company inaccurately.

title.children: Reddit challenges Australia's social media ban for under-16s

image.altText: A massive wave bursts into the air.

props.synopsis: A natural phenomenon leaves surfers in awe of the "earthquake" wave.

title.children: 'Magic wave' found off WA coast after surfer's decade-long search

image.altText: Dozens of police officers, protesters, and media on the steps of the convention centre surrounded by pepper spray.

props.synopsis: A Supreme Court judge awards $54,000 in damages to a protester who sued Victoria Police after officers used pepper spray at a protest in 2019 outside the Melbourne Exhibition Centre.

title.children: 'Cruel and degrading': Protester wins pepper-spray case against police

image.altText: Man in suit shaking hands with man in fluro work wear.

props.synopsis: A deal is being finalised between Tomago Aluminium and the state and federal governments to keep the smelter open beyond 2028.

title.children: Long-term power deal being finalised to keep aluminium smelter open

image.altText: A dark-haired man in sunglasses wears dark clothing as he walks along a street.

props.synopsis: Suspended NSW police officer Tylar Shepheard, charged with possessing child abuse material among other charges, has had strict conditions placed on him.

title.children: NSW police officer faces court over child abuse material charges

image.altText: A police car outside National Zoo and Aquarium.

props.synopsis: Jude Wijesinghe is sentenced to 30 years' jail for stabbing his Canberra zoo colleague Tshewang Choden to death in the storeroom of the kitchen area where they both worked.

title.children: Man jailed for murdering co-worker 'because he couldn't have her'

image.altText: Nemo stands on  stage after winning the trophy in 2024

props.synopsis: Swiss singer Nemo says they will return the trophy they won in 2024 over the EBU's decision to let Israel participate in 2026.

title.children: 2024 Eurovision winner returns trophy over Israel's participation
